sage.scene

Class SkyBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.SceneNode
      • sage.scene.Group
        • sage.scene.SkyBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<SceneNode>

    public class SkyBox
extends Group
    A SkyBox is a Group made of textured quads that simulates having a sky, horizon and ground around a scene. A SkyBox must move with the camera; it is the user's responsibility to either attach the SkyBox to an ICamera or else to update the SkyBox location to match the camera location at each frame draw time.
    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in JMonkeyEngine.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      An enumeration listing the six faces of the SkyBox by name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SkyBox

        public SkyBox()
        Constructs a SkyBox with a default name and with other attributes as defined by constructor SkyBox(String).

      • SkyBox

        public SkyBox(java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a SkyBox with the specified name and extents of 1 in each of postive and negative X, Y, and Z (so that the SkyBox is 2x2x2).
        Parameters:
        name - - the name associated with the SkyBox Group node

      • SkyBox

        public SkyBox(java.lang.String name,
              float xExtent,
              float yExtent,
              float zExtent)
        Creates a new SkyBox with the specified name and size attributes. By default, no textures are attached to the SkyBox sides. Note that the extent parameters specify the half-size in each direction, so that specifying extents of (1,1,1) results in a 2x2x2 SkyBox.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the SkyBox
        xExtent - - the x size of the SkyBox in each direction from the center
        yExtent - - the y size of the SkyBox in each direction from the center
        zExtent - - the z size of the SkyBox in each direction from the center

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(SkyBox.Face face,
                       Texture texture)
        Sets the texture to be displayed on the given face of the SkyBox, replacing any existing texture on that face. By default the method assumes the use of Texture Unit 0 to hold the texture.
        Parameters:
        face - - the face whose texture is to be set
        texture - - the texture for that face to assume
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified face is null.

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(SkyBox.Face face,
                       Texture texture,
                       int textureUnit)
        Sets the texture to be displayed on the given face of the SkyBox. Only replaces the texture at the index specified by textureUnit.
        Parameters:
        face - - the face whose texture is to be set
        texture - - the Texture for that face to assume
        textureUnit - - the texture unit to be used to hold the specified Texture

        public Texture getTexture(SkyBox.Face face)

        public Quad getFace(SkyBox.Face face)
        Retrieve the Quad indicated by the given face identifier.
        Parameters:
        face - - an element of SkyBox.Face
        Returns:
        - the Quad that makes up the specified side of the SkyBox

      • setZBufferStateEnabled

        public void setZBufferStateEnabled(boolean state)
        Sets the state of the ZBuffer RenderState object for the SkyBox to the specified state (enabled or disabled).
        Parameters:
        state - - the new state of the ZBufferState for the Quads making up the SkyBox

      • preloadTexture

        public void preloadTexture(SkyBox.Face face)

      • preloadTextures

        public void preloadTextures()
        Force all of the textures to load. This prevents pauses later during the application as you pan around the world.
